results.brief_description: An animated conflict between man and a woman - the both being handformed from shape to shape. An interesting interpretation of male and female roles.

results.title: Appearance
results.brief_description: Few of us are happy about the way we look. We are either too short or too fat; our noses are too big or the wrong shape. As more people resort to surgery to alter appearance, this program talks to people about what they’ve done and the effect that it has had on their lives.

results.title: Apollo soyuz
results.creator_credit: David Gerber, Screen Presentation and Byron Morgan
results.brief_description: Describes the agreements and preparation for the 1975 Apollo Soyuz international space mission. The United States and the USSR May 1972 agreement for this joint mission in space includes standardization of docking procedures and equipment that will increase safety, provides for dual rescue missions, and opens up new opportunities for further research and discoveries. Narrated by Yul Brynner and Paul Picerni.

results.title: Apollo 17: on the shoulder of giants
results.creator_credit: Don Wiseman and A V Corporation
results.brief_description: A record of the final manned flight to the moon in the Apollo series, this film shows the astronauts, Eugene Cernan, Harrison E. Schmit and Ronald E. Evans - one of them in this case, a geologist - examining the moon’s surface, probing it and collecting samples and setting up various testing apparatus. With clearer photography than seen in earlier films, there are some excellent views of both the earth and the moon recorded from space. Also includes intercuts of Skylab, the 1975 Apollo-Soyuz co-operative and the space shuttle.The sub title derives from a saying of Sir Isaac Newton, who, when his work was praised, modestly replied that his achievement was due to the fact that he was carried to his goal on the shoulders of giants.

results.title: Apollo 12: pinpoint for science
results.brief_description: The story of the flight of Apollo 12 and the second landing of men on the moon on November 19th 1969. Gives primary emphasis to the lunar exploration carried out by the crew; deployment of scientific equipment, retrieval of parts of a Surveyor space craft which landed on the moon in 1967, and the collection of rock and soil samples. No other credits available

results.title: Apollo 11: one giant leap for mankind
results.brief_description: Follows the flight of Apollo 11 to the Moon and back, showing the launching and each stage of the operation with views and comments of the astronauts, their activities on the surface and return trip to President Nixon’s welcome No other credits available
